definition[0]: the difference in value between the goods a country buys from abroad and the goods it sells abroad
definition[1]: the part of a country’s balance of payments that relates to the value of goods and services imported and exported
example[0]: The overall balance of trade in the UK is improving as a result of the strong currency.
definition[2]: the difference in the total value of imports and exports between two countries or areas
example[1]: The US and Europe sell nearly $100 billion worth of goods and services a year to each other. For the moment, the balance of trade is in the US’s favor.
